content: melt the ice mini hat terms chain chain double_crochet double_crochet dcblo double_crochet back loop fpdc front post double_crochet bpdc back post double_crochet increase double_crochet twice in same stitch sl slip_stitch dk yarn about 3 grams or 10 yards e hook chain 2 at beginning of row does not count as a stitch leave a long tail when you begin your magic_ring to create the tassel tail about 8 inches create a really long tassel tail if you want to tie the mini hat around your purse handle as an ornament r1 magic_ring chain 2 9 double_crochet in ring close ring but not super tight join with sl to top of first double_crochet 9dc r2 chain 2 double_crochet double_crochet increase repeat around join with sl to top of first double_crochet 12 double_crochet r3 chain 2 double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet increase repeat around join with sl to top of first double_crochet 15 double_crochet r4 chain 2 dcblo in each stitch join with sl to top of first double_crochet 15 double_crochet r5 ch2 fpdc around chain 2 of previous round need an extra stitch to have an even number bpdc in next stitch repeat fpdc bpdc around join with a sl in first fpdc 16 double_crochet r6 chain 2 fpdc in the fpdc stitches and bpdc in the bpdc around join with a slip_stitch cut and weave in your end 16 double_crochet use your hook to go through the center hole of the magic_ring to grab your tail and pull up a loop using the rest of the tail make chain stitches as long as you want the tassel tail to be cut 3 four inch pieces of yarn with a yarn needle thread them 1/2 way through the last chain and tie a knot hold the ends together and wrap another piece of yarn around them a couple times just below the knot to create the tassel tie that off trim ends to be even
